title: How does one get ahold of Linux fonts if you're on a Mac?
content: There's several GREAT sets of fonts from Bitstream, one of which I desperately need to finish a job, but unfortunately, the font is ONLY available through the Linspire people, and ONLY if you're running their software, due to their shopping cart setup. Being on OSX 10.3.8, that won't happen. So how can I get ahold of the font, which is named Crazy Loot?
author: dunnyman

comments.content:
They're available from [Buy Creative](http://web.archive.org/web/20050515203339/http:/cga.buycreative.com/products/fonts/viewproduct.php?pid=8048) as well. Incidentally, the copyrigh string reads:   
   
(C) 2003 Bitstream Inc. & Font Diner.   
All Rights Reserved. Designed by Stuart Sandler. [http://www.fontdiner.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20050515203339/http:/www.fontdiner.com/) ROE
What is the easiest way to unstuff a traditional Mac font onto Linux such that none of the constituents become zeroed? I have completely forgotten how to do this.
